{"rule":"FILE_EXTENSIONS_CASE","sentence":"^\\QProof: If \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q is a discrete random variable, then by the property of convex function, we know that for \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q that only has 2 possible values, we have \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q Then assume that inequality holds for \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q that has \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q possible values, then for \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q that has \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q possible values, we have \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q If x is a continuous random variable(domain is \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q), and \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q is the corresponding pdf, then \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+$"}
